title: First Trailer for Hulu's 'Washington Black' Starring Ernest Kingsley Jr.
description: "This just ain't his story. It's our story." "A gripping historical narrative exploring both the bounds of slavery and what it means to be truly free." "This just ain't his story. It's our story." Hulu has revealed the first official trailer for a worldwide adventure series called Washington Black, arriving to watch starting in July this summer. "A gripping historical narrative exploring both the bounds of slavery and what it means to be truly free." Based on the bestselling novel of the same name, Hulu's Washington Black follows the 19th-century odyssey of George Washington "Wash" Black, an 11-year-old boy born on a Barbados sugar plantation, whose prodigious scientific mind sets him on a path of unexpected destiny. When a harrowing incident forces Wash to flee, he is thrust into a globe-spanning adventure that challenges and reshapes his understanding of family, freedom and love. The series stars Ernest Kingsley Jr. as Washington Black, Rupert Graves as Mr. Goff, Iola Evans as Tanna Goff, Edward Bluemel as William McGee, Sharon Duncan Brewster as Miss Angie, Eddie Karanja as Young Washington Black, Tom Ellis as Titch, featuring Sterling K. Brown as Medwin. This reminds me of the other Captain Nemo series, it looks quite similar with adventures underwater & all over the place.
